Key Match Events: Heinrich Klaasen scored 109 runs from 67 balls
Kagiso Rabada took an absolute stunner off the bowling of Lungi Ngidi
Harry Brook's 17 was the best among England's top six batters
Marco Jansen hit a fiery unbeaten 75
Pre-Game Insights: England made three changes to their setup after the loss to Afghanistan
South Africa made a change due to Temba Bavuma's illness, with Aiden Markram captaining in his stead
Post-Match Reflections: No post-match reflections provided in the article
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side
Others: England crumbled in the 22nd over itself
South Africa beat defending champions, England by a margin of 229 runs
Gerald Coetzee (3/35), Lungi Ngidi (2/26), and Marco Jansen (2/35) were the main wicket-takers for South Africa
All England bowlers were dispatched for runs
Reece Topley (3/88), Gus Atkinson (2/60) and Adil Rashid (2/61) among wickets for England
Aiden Markram and Heinrich Klaasen added 69 runs off 58 balls
Jonny Bairstow held on to a tough catch despite slipping up in the outfield
Topley struck once again, in the 37th over to account for David Miller
Klaasen's century came off 61 balls in the 47th over
Jansen's half-century came off 35 balls in the very next over
The duo added 151 runs from merely 77 balls to help South Africa close in on 400
Quinton de Kock began with a four off a drive for South Africa, but was sent back to the pavilion off the very next ball
Reeza Hendricks hit 85 from 75 against England at Wankhede
Hendricks and van der Dussen kept South Africa's charge going in decent batting conditions
Rashid struck back in the next over. Rassie van der Dussen top-edged straight to mid-wicket
England and South Africa look to bounce back as Cricket World Cup lands in Mumbai
